content: @Jose Costa Teixeira , yes, I work pretty regularly with that group.

A year ago I was of the impression that we would at some point do away with bpmn completely. For instance by looking at the way things were evolving here: https://simplifier.net/NCCNChemotherapyOrde). Some time ago I came across this https://www.trisotech.com/wp-content/uploads/OMG-Field-Guide-to-sharable-Clinical-Pathways.pdf It remains quite vague on workflow implemntation in FHIR.
How do FHIR Workflow efforts tie into the bpm-plus project?
Where does FHIR end and bpm+ begin?

The workflow group has been having discussions and reviewing how BPM+ and PlanDefinition can be mapped. You can look at the minutes for some of the information, and I believe the next call is part of that series.
I think we have been focusing on BPMN. Actually my motivation for the question is to see where CMMN starts fitting in what we are doing
